resources.string: A Spanish menu of tapas, paella and sangria served in a cozy, lively neighborhood space.
Modern spot for Mediterranean eats in an arty, upbeat atmosphere, plus happy hour and patio seating.
White-tablecloth restaurant serving grilled kebabs and other Persian classics, plus steaks and seafood.
Upscale lounge for drinks and Californian shared plates in a historic, Barbary Coast–era structure.
A stylish, literary-themed bar with drinks named after characters, punch on tap and book-lined walls.
Pub grub and draft beer are on tap at this low-key, brick-walled hangout serving food late at night.
Stylish setting for wine, cheese and charcuterie also offers beer and wine by the bottle.
Sushi Union Square is the teeming commercial hub of the city. Many major hotels and department stores are packed into the area surrounding the actual square.

This Greco-Roman palace and architectural attraction hosts an ever-changing roster of performing arts. This article is about the structure in San Francisco Marina District. For the structure on Treasure Island, San Francisco, see Palace of Fine and Decorative Arts, Treasure Island. For the Mexico City opera house, see Palacio de Bellas Artes.

Market Street is a major thoroughfare in San Francisco, California. It begins at The Embarcadero in front of the Ferry Building at the northeastern edge of the city and runs southwest through downtown, passing the Civic Center and the Castro District, to the intersection with Corbett Avenue in the Twin Peaks neighborhood. Beyond this point, the roadway continues as Portola Drive into the southwestern quadrant of San Francisco. Portola Drive extends south to the intersection of St.

The Golden Gate Bridge is a suspension bridge spanning the Golden Gate, the one-mile-wide (1.6 km) strait connecting San Francisco Bay and the Pacific Ocean. The structure links the American city of San Francisco, California – the northern tip of the San Francisco Peninsula – to Marin County, carrying both U.S. Route 101 and California State Route 1 across the strait. The bridge is one of the most internationally recognized symbols of San Francisco, California, and the United States. It has been declared one of the Wonders of the Modern World by the American Society of Civil Engineers
Golden Gate Bridge, San Francisco, CA
